summary: This document is an email chain from June 2024 between attorney Erica Dubno and others, discussing efforts to obtain a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office or Department of Justice in support of a victim's immigration application (specifically an I-914 Supplement B). The correspondence references prior collaboration with the FBI and Sanctuary for Families, and includes attachments of draft letters and FBI documents from 2022.

persons.name: Erica T. Dubno
persons.context: Attorney from Fahrinqer & Dubno law firm, leading the correspondence to seek a support letter from the Justice Department for a victim's immigration application. She drafts letters and coordinates with others.

persons.name: Nicole Young
persons.context: FBI Special Agent at the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk. Corresponded in 2022 regarding finalized forms and approvals for the victim's case.

persons.name: Jessica-Wind Abolafia
persons.context: Director of the Anti-Trafficking Initiative at Sanctuary for Families. Actively corresponded in 2022, providing draft immigration documents (I-914 Supplement B) and details on victimization dates (2003-2018) to the FBI.

connections.description: Collaborating on legal support for a victim, with Dubno as the attorney and Abolafia providing support from Sanctuary for Families on immigration documents.
Dubno is seeking a support letter from Young's office (FBI/DOJ) for a victim's immigration application, referencing prior provided documents from 2022.
Abolafia corresponded with FBI Special Agent Young in 2022, sending draft immigration documents and victimization details for review and signature.

events.title: Deadline for response to NM
events.description: Deadline to send a full response to NM, prompting the urgent request for a letter from the Justice Department.

events.title: FBI provides finalized forms
events.description: FBI Special Agent Nicole Young sent finalized forms related to the victim's case.

events.title: Period of victimization
events.description: Dates of victimization for NM, as noted in the draft I-914 Supplement B immigration document.

keyFacts: The correspondence seeks a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office or Department of Justice to support a victim's immigration application (I-914 Supplement B).
The victim, referred to as 'NM', experienced victimization from approximately 2003 to 2018.
Attorney Erica Dubno and Sanctuary for Families' Jessica-Wind Abolafia collaborated with FBI Special Agent Nicole Young on this case as early as 2022.
The email chain includes attachments of prior FBI correspondence and draft support letters, indicating ongoing legal efforts to assist the victim.
The victim is described as 'working on her healing and finally trying to put all of this' behind her, highlighting the personal impact and recovery process.
